title.en: Genealogical Tables of the Three Dynasties

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：五帝、三代之記，尚矣。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Five Emperors, Three Dynasties records, far ancient.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: The records of the Five Emperors and Three Dynasties go far back in time.

sentences.zh: 自殷以前諸侯不可得而譜，周以來乃頗可著。

translations.literal: From Yin before feudal lords cannot obtained and genealogized, Zhou since then considerably can recorded.
translations.idiomatic: Before the Yin dynasty, the feudal lords cannot be genealogically charted. Since the Zhou, they can be considerably recorded.

sentences.zh: 孔子因史文次春秋，紀元年，正時日月，蓋其詳哉。

translations.literal: Confucius followed historical texts arranged Spring Autumn, recorded first year, corrected seasons days months, indeed its detailed.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius followed the historical texts and arranged the Spring and Autumn Annals, recording the first year, correcting the seasons, days, and months - indeed how detailed!

sentences.zh: 至於序尚書則略，無年月；

translations.literal: As for arranging the Documents of Antiquity then brief, no years months;
translations.idiomatic: As for arranging the Documents of Antiquity, it was brief, with no years or months;

sentences.zh: 或頗有，然多闕，不可錄。

translations.literal: Some considerably had, yet many missing, cannot recorded.
translations.idiomatic: Some considerably had them, yet many were missing and could not be recorded.

sentences.zh: 故疑則傳疑，蓋其慎也。

translations.literal: Therefore doubt then transmit doubt, indeed its cautious.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore when in doubt, transmit doubt - indeed how cautious!

translations.literal: The Grand Historian said: The records of the Five Emperors and Three Dynasties go far back in time. Before the Yin dynasty, the feudal lords cannot be genealogically charted. Since the Zhou, they can be considerably recorded. Confucius followed the historical texts and arranged the Spring and Autumn Annals, recording the first year, correcting the seasons, days, and months - indeed how detailed! As for arranging the Documents of Antiquity, it was brief, with no years or months; Some considerably had them, yet many were missing and could not be recorded. Therefore when in doubt, transmit doubt - indeed how cautious!

sentences.zh: 余讀諜記，黃帝以來皆有年數。

translations.literal: I read secret records, Yellow Emperor since all have year numbers.
translations.idiomatic: I read secret records - since the Yellow Emperor, all have year counts.

sentences.zh: 稽其歷譜諜終始五德之傳，古文咸不同，乖異。

translations.literal: Check their calendar genealogies secret records beginning end five virtues transmission, ancient texts all different, divergent.
translations.idiomatic: Checking their calendar genealogies and secret records of the beginning and end of the five virtues transmission, the ancient texts are all different and divergent.

sentences.zh: 夫子之弗論次其年月，豈虛哉！

translations.literal: Master not discussed arranged their years months, how vain!
translations.idiomatic: The Master did not discuss and arrange their years and months - how could it be in vain!

sentences.zh: 於是以五帝系諜、尚書集世紀黃帝以連山訖共和為世表。

translations.literal: Thereupon with Five Emperors genealogical records, Documents of Antiquity collected century Yellow Emperor with Lianshan until Gonghe as generation table.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon, using the Five Emperors genealogical records and the Documents of Antiquity collected century, from the Yellow Emperor through Lianshan until Gonghe as the generation table.

translations.literal: I read secret records - since the Yellow Emperor, all have year counts. Checking their calendar genealogies and secret records of the beginning and end of the five virtues transmission, the ancient texts are all different and divergent. The Master did not discuss and arrange their years and months - how could it be in vain! Thereupon, using the Five Emperors genealogical records and the Documents of Antiquity collected century, from the Yellow Emperor through Lianshan until Gonghe as the generation table.

cells.content: 齊太公尚，文王、武王師。初封。
秦惡來，助紂。父飛廉，有力。
楚熊繹。繹父鬻熊，事文王。初封。

cells.literal: Cao Uncle Zhen Duo, Martial King younger brother. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Uncle Cao Zhen Duo, younger brother of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Yan Duke of Shao Shi, Zhou same surname. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Duke of Shao of Yan, same surname as Zhou. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Kang King Zhao punishments weapons forty more years.
cells.idiomatic: King Kang Zhao - punishments and weapons unused for forty-plus years.
Wei Zhong, younger brother of Qi.

cells.content: 昭王瑕南巡不返。不赴，諱之。
cells.literal: Zhao King Xia south toured not return. Not attended, tabooed it.
cells.idiomatic: King Zhao Xia toured south and did not return. Did not attend, tabooed it.

cells.content: 穆王滿。作甫刑。荒服不至。
cells.literal: Mu King Man. Made Fu punishments. Remote service not arrived.
cells.idiomatic: King Mu Man. Made the Fu punishments. Remote service did not arrive.

cells.literal: Yang duke, Kao duke younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Yang, younger brother of Duke Kao.

cells.literal: Min duke, Ding duke younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Min, younger brother of Duke Ding.

cells.content: 懿王堅。周道衰，詩人作刺。
cells.literal: Yi King Jian. Zhou way declined, poets made satire.
cells.idiomatic: King Yi Jian. Zhou way declined, poets made satire.

cells.literal: Yang duke, Min duke younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Yang, younger brother of Duke Min.

cells.literal: Xiao King Fang, Yi king younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: King Xiao Fang, younger brother of King Yi.

cells.literal: Yi King Xie, Yi king son.
cells.idiomatic: King Yi Xie, son of King Yi.

cells.literal: Xian duke, Li duke younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Xian, younger brother of Duke Li.

cells.content: 厲王胡。以惡聞過亂，出奔，遂死於彘。
cells.literal: Li King Hu. Because hated hearing faults chaos, fled, then died at Zhi.
cells.idiomatic: King Li Hu. Because hated hearing faults and caused chaos, fled, then died at Zhi.
Xiong Yan, younger brother of Hong.
Gonghe, the two Bo administered the government.

cells.literal: Wu duke, Zhen duke younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Wu, younger brother of Duke Zhen.

sentences.zh: 張夫子問褚先生曰：「詩言契、后稷皆無父而生。

translations.literal: Zhang Fuzi asked Chu Mr said: 'Poetry speaks Jie, Hou Ji all no father born.
translations.idiomatic: Master Zhang asked Master Chu said: 'The Poetry says Jie and Hou Ji were both born without fathers.

sentences.zh: 今案諸傳記咸言有父，父皆黃帝子也，得無與詩謬秋？」

translations.literal: Now examine various biographies all say have father, fathers all Yellow Emperor sons also, can it be with poetry contradictory?'
translations.idiomatic: Now examining the various biographies, they all say they had fathers, and the fathers were all sons of the Yellow Emperor. Could it be contradictory to the Poetry?'

translations.literal: Master Zhang asked Master Chu said: 'The Poetry says Jie and Hou Ji were both born without fathers. Now examining the various biographies, they all say they had fathers, and the fathers were all sons of the Yellow Emperor. Could it be contradictory to the Poetry?'

sentences.zh: 褚先生曰：「不然。

translations.literal: Chu Mr said: 'Not so.
translations.idiomatic: Master Chu said: 'Not so.

sentences.zh: 詩言契生於卵，后稷人跡者，欲見其有天命精誠之意耳。

translations.literal: Poetry speaks Jie born from egg, Hou Ji human footprints, wished to show they had heaven mandate sincere intentions only.
translations.idiomatic: The Poetry speaks of Jie being born from an egg and Hou Ji from human footprints, only wishing to show they had heaven's mandate and sincere intentions.

sentences.zh: 鬼神不能自成，須人而生，柰何無父而生乎！

translations.literal: Ghosts spirits cannot self-complete, must rely on people born, how can no father born!
translations.idiomatic: Ghosts and spirits cannot complete themselves, they must be born through people. How could they be born without fathers!

sentences.zh: 一言有父，一言無父，信以傳信，疑以傳疑，故兩言之。

translations.literal: One says has father, one says no father, believe to transmit believe, doubt to transmit doubt, therefore both speak.
translations.idiomatic: One says they had fathers, one says they had no fathers. Transmit what is believable as believable, transmit doubts as doubts, therefore both are spoken.

sentences.zh: 堯知契、稷皆賢人，天之所生，故封之契七十里，後十餘世至湯，王天下。

translations.literal: Yao knew Jie, Ji all worthy people, heaven what born, therefore enfeoffed Jie seventy li, after ten more generations to Tang, king tianxia.
translations.idiomatic: Yao knew Jie and Ji were both worthy people, born by heaven, therefore enfeoffed Jie with seventy li, and after ten-plus generations came to Tang who became king of tianxia.

sentences.zh: 堯知后稷子孫之後王也，故益封之百里，其後世且千歲，至文王而有天下。

translations.literal: Yao knew Hou Ji descendants later kings also, therefore additionally enfeoffed him hundred li, his later generations nearly thousand years, to Wen Wang then had tianxia.
translations.idiomatic: Yao knew Hou Ji's descendants would later be kings, therefore additionally enfeoffed him with a hundred li. His later generations lasted nearly a thousand years, until Wen Wang then had tianxia.

sentences.zh: 詩傳曰：『湯之先為契，無父而生。

translations.literal: Poetry transmission said: 'Tang what ancestor Jie, no father born.
translations.idiomatic: The Poetry transmission said: 'Tang's ancestor was Jie, born without a father.

sentences.zh: 契母與姊妹浴於玄丘水，有燕銜卵墮之，契母得，故含之，誤吞之，即生契。

translations.literal: Jie mother with elder sisters bathed at Xuanqiu water, had swallow held egg fell it, Jie mother got, therefore held it, mistakenly swallowed it, immediately gave birth Jie.
translations.idiomatic: Jie's mother was bathing with her sisters at Xuanqiu water when a swallow holding an egg dropped it. Jie's mother got it, therefore held it, mistakenly swallowed it, and immediately gave birth to Jie.

sentences.zh: 契生而賢，堯立為司徒，姓之曰子氏。

translations.literal: Jie born and worthy, Yao established as Situ, surnamed him Zi clan.
translations.idiomatic: Jie was born worthy. Yao established him as Situ and surnamed him the Zi clan.

sentences.zh: 子者茲；

translations.literal: Zi what Ci;
translations.idiomatic: Zi means Ci;

sentences.zh: 茲，益大也。

translations.literal: Ci, increasingly great also.
translations.idiomatic: Ci means increasingly great.

sentences.zh: 詩人美而頌之曰「殷社芒芒，天命玄鳥，降而生商」。

translations.literal: Poets praised and praised him said 'Yin altar vast vast, heaven mandate dark bird, descended gave birth Shang'.
translations.idiomatic: The poets praised and sang of him saying 'The Yin altar is vast and vast, heaven's mandate dark bird descended and gave birth to Shang'.

sentences.zh: 商者質，殷號也。

translations.literal: Shang what solid, Yin designation also.
translations.idiomatic: Shang is solid, Yin's designation.

sentences.zh: 文王之先為后稷，后稷亦無父而生。

translations.literal: Wen Wang what ancestor Hou Ji, Hou Ji also no father born.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Wang's ancestor was Hou Ji, Hou Ji also born without a father.

sentences.zh: 后稷母為姜嫄，出見大人蹟而履踐之，知於身，則生后稷。
姜嫄以為無父，賤而棄之道中，牛羊避不踐也。
抱之山中，山者養之。
又捐之大澤，鳥覆席食之。
姜嫄怪之，於是知其天子，乃取長之。
堯知其賢才，立以為大農，姓之曰姬氏。
姬者，本也。
詩人美而頌之曰「厥初生民」，深修益成，而道后稷之始也。』
孔子曰：『昔者堯命契為子氏，為有湯也。
命后稷為姬氏，為有文王也。
大王命季歷，明天瑞也。
太伯之吳，遂生源也。』
天命難言，非聖人莫能見。
舜、禹、契、后稷皆黃帝子孫也。
黃帝策天命而治天下，德澤深後世，故其子孫皆復立為天子，是天之報有德也。
人不知，以為閒從布衣匹夫起耳。
夫布衣匹夫安能無故而起王天下乎？
其有天命然。」

translations.literal: Master Chu said: 'Not so. The Poetry speaks of Jie being born from an egg and Hou Ji from human footprints, only wishing to show they had heaven's mandate and sincere intentions. Ghosts and spirits cannot complete themselves, they must be born through people. How could they be born without fathers! One says they had fathers, one says they had no fathers. Transmit what is believable as believable, transmit doubts as doubts, therefore both are spoken. Yao knew Jie and Ji were both worthy people, born by heaven, therefore enfeoffed Jie with seventy li, and after ten-plus generations came to Tang who became king of tianxia. Yao knew Hou Ji's descendants would later be kings, therefore additionally enfeoffed him with a hundred li. His later generations lasted nearly a thousand years, until Wen Wang then had tianxia. The Poetry transmission said: 'Tang's ancestor was Jie, born without a father. Jie's mother was bathing with her sisters at Xuanqiu water when a swallow holding an egg dropped it. Jie's mother got it, therefore held it, mistakenly swallowed it, and immediately gave birth to Jie. Jie was born worthy. Yao established him as Situ and surnamed him the Zi clan. Zi means Ci; Ci means increasingly great. The poets praised and sang of him saying 'The Yin altar is vast and vast, heaven's mandate dark bird descended and gave birth to Shang'. Shang is solid, Yin's designation. Wen Wang's ancestor was Hou Ji, Hou Ji also born without a father.

sentences.zh: 「黃帝後世何王天下之久遠邪？」

translations.literal: 'Why did the Yellow Emperor's descendants rule All Under Heaven for such a long time?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「傳云天下之君王為萬夫之黔首請贖民之命者帝，有福萬世。
黃帝是也。
五政明則修禮義，因天時舉兵征伐而利者王，有福千世。
蜀王，黃帝後世也，至今在漢西南五千里，常來朝降，輸獻於漢，非以其先之有德，澤流後世邪？
行道德豈可以忽秋哉！
人君王者舉而觀之。
漢大將軍霍子孟名光者，亦黃帝後世也。
此可為博聞遠見者言，固難為淺聞者說也。
何以言之？
古諸侯以國為姓。
霍者，國名也。
武王封弟叔處於霍，後世晉獻公滅霍公，後世為庶民，往來居平陽。
平陽在河東，河東晉地，分為衛國。
以詩言之，亦可為周世。
周起后稷，后稷無父而生。
以三代世傳言之，后稷有父名高辛；
高辛，黃帝曾孫。
黃帝終始傳曰：『漢興百有餘年，有人不短不長，出（自）［白］燕之鄉，持天下之政，時有嬰兒主，欲行車。』
霍將軍者，本居平陽（自）［白］燕。
臣為郎時，與方士考功會旗亭下，為臣言。
豈不偉哉！」

translations.literal: He said: 'The tradition says that rulers of All Under Heaven who for ten thousand people redeem the people's fate are emperors, and have blessing for ten thousand generations. The Yellow Emperor was such. When the five government affairs are clear, then cultivate ritual and righteousness, follow Heaven's seasons to raise troops and campaign successfully—that is ruling, with blessing for a thousand generations. The King of Shu was Yellow Emperor descendants; to this day in the southwest five thousand li from Han, they constantly come to court and pay tribute to Han—not because their ancestors had virtue that flowed to later generations? How can practicing morality be neglected? Ruling lords should raise this up and observe it. The Han General Huo Qubing, named Guang, was also Yellow Emperor descendants. This can be told to those of broad learning and far sight; it is difficult to explain to those of shallow knowledge. Why speak thus? Ancient feudal lords took countries as surnames. Huo was a country name. King Wu enfeoffed his younger brother Shu at Huo; later generations Duke Xian of Jin extinguished Duke Huo, later generations became commoners, coming and going dwelling at Pingyang. Pingyang is in Hedong, Hedong is Jin territory, divided into Wei country. Speaking with the Poetry, it can also be considered Zhou generations. Zhou arose from Hou Ji; Hou Ji was born without a father. Speaking with the Three Dynasties genealogical transmissions, Hou Ji had a father named Gao Xin; Gao Xin was Yellow Emperor's great-grandson. The Yellow Emperor beginning and end transmission says: 'When Han rose, more than a century, there will be a person not short not tall, coming from Yan's white region, holding All Under Heaven's government; at that time there will be an infant ruler, desiring to proceed by cart.' General Huo originally dwelt at Pingyang in Yan. When I was a gentleman attendant, with the fangshi I examined merit at the banner pavilion below, and he told me. Is this not magnificent!'
